answers.answer: I had gestational diabetes with my last pregnancy. If you pop me a message on here ill let you know what foods to avoid to keep your blood sugars in a healthy range xx
I'm going thru this now and let me tell u I still can't get use to the gestational diabetes diet they have me on so what ever u do eat healthy

Any tips would be great ...I've never had sugar in my urine my blood pressure is always good ..no problems at all ...I had a healthy little girl in 05 also with no gestational diabetes scares ...they didn't give me a specific diet all they told Mr was no sugary foods stay away from a lot of bread an I should be ok ..140 is a fail an i was 135 ....also I'm 28 weeks
I failed by 5 points also! I have to go next Friday for the stupid 3 hour test..I'm freaking out about what to eat...to the point that even water makes me feel guilty :(

U have to have carbs to keep ur sugar in a good range.  Here's my meal plan bc.I have GD breakfast - wheat toast and egg or some meat or just peanut butter. Check my blood 2hrs later then a snack of a granola bar 22-36g of carbs and half a banana.  Lunch sandwich with wheat bread and maybe a cup of fruit. Check bold two hrs later then another snack of maybe something with total carbs of 11-22g then dinner something total carbs 11-22g and something 23-37g. Check blood then a snack carbs 11-22g. Always have protein with each meal that could ne nuts ir cheese or.meat. hope this helps. Its hard to explain while using my phone. Any questions message me.
Thank u for the advice ill definitely use it ..hopefully I can just get through the rest of this pregnancy without having it completely developed ..good luck to you guys as well :)
with my 1st pregnancy and this one which is my 3rd i failed my 1 hr then took 3 hr and passed

If you can handle it while pregnant, tuna fish is also an excellent source of protein and can be eaten on moderation during pregnancy. The trick is to try to avoid refined sugar and eat protein to sustain your blood sugar. I had this with my second and third and just avoided sweets as much as possible and ate healthy with lots of protein and was ok

I was thinkin about getting a bunch of the canned chicken and salad gear ..my Dr isn't making me do the 3 hour test because technically I didn't fail I'm just on the middle mark..I fasted the morning of but drank no water I wonder if that makes a difference ..Ty for the responses

question: Well I got my glucose test results back today my Dr says between 130 and 140 are ok I got 135 theyre not sending me for the 3 hour test but I have to be really be careful with my diet my exercising is already good..anyone else get not so good results ?any tips
title: borderline gestational diabetic?!
